label: Severe Thinness
description: Severe thinness can lead to a compromised immune system, increased susceptibility to infections, anemia, osteoporosis, muscle wasting, menstrual irregularities in females, and psychological issues such as anxiety and depression.

recommendation.title: Consult with a specialist
recommendation.description: Seek assistance from a healthcare provider and nutritionist to establish an appropriate dietary plan, supplement micronutrients, and closely monitor the individual’s health status.

recommendation.title: Dietary adjustments
recommendation.description: Provide a high-calorie and nutrient-dense diet, particularly rich in protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals, to support recovery.

recommendation.title: Encourage light physical activity
recommendation.description: Promote gentle physical activities to help restore muscle mass and maintain overall health.

label: Thinness
description: Thinness can lead to fatigue, reduced immune function, increased susceptibility to infections, digestive issues, poor nutrient absorption, hair loss, dry skin, and delayed wound healing.

recommendation.title: Consultation with a physician and nutrition expert
recommendation.description: Seek advice from a healthcare provider to determine the underlying causes and develop an appropriate nutritional plan.

recommendation.title: Nutrient-rich diet
recommendation.description: Ensure adequate intake of calories, proteins, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals. Divide meals into smaller, more frequent portions and prioritize energy-dense foods.

recommendation.title: Healthy lifestyle
recommendation.description: Incorporate light physical activity and ensure sufficient rest and sleep to support overall health and recovery.

label: Underweight
description: Underweight may impact the body’s immune function and recovery capacity.

recommendation.title: Nutritional improvement
recommendation.description: Increase intake of nutrient-dense foods, especially those rich in protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals.

recommendation.title: Consultation with a physician or nutritionist
recommendation.description: Discuss the nutritional status with a healthcare professional and develop a plan for adequate nutrient supplementation.

recommendation.title: Healthy lifestyle
recommendation.description: Ensure adequate sleep, engage in regular physical activity, and manage stress levels to support overall health.

label: Normal
description: The body is developing proportionally and within a healthy range.

recommendation.title: Maintain a balanced diet
recommendation.description: Continue consuming a variety of nutrient-rich foods, including adequate amounts of protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals to support overall health.

recommendation.title: Encourage physical activity
recommendation.description: Aim for at least 150 minutes of exercise per week, which is recommended for maintaining cardiovascular health and overall well-being.

recommendation.title: Regular health monitoring
recommendation.description: Schedule routine health check-ups to detect potential health issues early and take timely corrective measures if necessary.

label: Pre-obesity
description: Pre-obesity increases the risk of developing various health conditions, including type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, cardiovascular disease, dyslipidemia, fatty liver disease, joint problems, sleep apnea, and certain types of cancer.

recommendation.title: Dietary adjustments
recommendation.description: Reduce the intake of high-calorie, sugary, and unhealthy fat-laden foods. Increase the consumption of vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and lean protein sources to improve nutritional intake and support weight loss.

recommendation.title: Encourage physical activity
recommendation.description: Engage in at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week to help burn calories and maintain a stable weight.

recommendation.title: Stress and sleep management
recommendation.description: Manage stress effectively and ensure sufficient sleep to support the weight loss process and overall well-being.

label: Class 1 Obesity
description: Class 1 obesity increases the risk of developing a variety of health conditions, including type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease, high blood pressure, dyslipidemia, fatty liver disease, joint problems, sleep apnea, and certain cancers.

recommendation.title: Consult a healthcare provider or nutritionist
recommendation.description: Schedule an appointment to assess health status and receive guidance on a balanced diet and safe, effective weight loss plan.

recommendation.title: Dietary modifications
recommendation.description: Reduce caloric intake and limit foods high in unhealthy fats. Increase the consumption of vegetables, fruits, and whole grains. Consider smaller, more frequent meals to help control food intake.

recommendation.title: Promote physical activity
recommendation.description: Engage in appropriate physical activities, such as walking, running, swimming, or muscle-strengthening exercises, to burn excess calories and improve overall fitness.

label: Class 2 Obesity
description: Class 2 obesity significantly increases the risk of developing health conditions such as Type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease, hypertension, dyslipidemia, fatty liver disease, joint problems, sleep apnea, stroke, and certain types of cancer.

recommendation.title: Strict dietary plan
recommendation.description: Significantly reduce calorie intake, particularly processed foods, sugars, and unhealthy fats. Increase the consumption of vegetables, fruits, lean proteins, and whole grains.

recommendation.title: Increase physical activity
recommendation.description: Engage in at least 150 minutes of physical exercise each week. Consider consulting a physician or fitness trainer to develop an appropriate exercise plan.

recommendation.title: Specialized medical consultation
recommendation.description: See a doctor to assess the associated health risks. Medical or surgical weight loss interventions may be considered if necessary.

label: Class 3 Obesity
description: Class 3 obesity significantly increases the risk of developing serious health conditions such as type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease, stroke, sleep apnea, joint problems, and many other serious health issues.

recommendation.title: Strict and scientific dietary plan
recommendation.description: Follow a calorie-restricted diet focused on nutrient-dense foods such as vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and lean proteins.

recommendation.title: Increase physical activity with supervision
recommendation.description: Start with light exercises and gradually increase intensity as directed by a physician or trainer.

recommendation.title: Specialized medical intervention
recommendation.description: Consult a specialist to assess your overall health condition and consider treatment options such as weight loss surgery or pharmacological interventions.
